title: Ticket #6680: late materialization itemdata should be spooled
description:
When submitting late materialization jobs, itemdata from the QUEUE statement should be sent to the schedd and stored in the SPOOL directory beside the spooled submit digest.

a new RPC will be added to the SCHEDD qmgr. SendMaterializeData which will accept a cluster id and a stream of lines of data. The RPC can only be called during submission (after NewCluster is called) and the cluster id must be the one returned by NewCluster

The schedd will write the stream of materialize data into a file at 

$(SPOOL)/$(Cluster)%10000/condor_submit.$(Cluster).items
It will also store the materialization data into a pending job factory in anticipation of getting a SendJobFactory RPC and then a cluster ad.

This RPC will then return the full path name to the spooled itemdata so that the client can include that filename in the submit digest that it sends using a subsequent SentJobFactory RPC

The spooled materialize data file will be used when the Schedd is restarted.

In order to future-proof the file format, and to support submit from python bindings. The materialization itemdata will support using the 0x1F character as a field separator as an optional alternate to the current space and/or comma field separator used by the current submit file parser.

When the queue statement indicates that there are multiple fields, the itemdata splitter will check for the 0x1F chararacter, and if it finds one, then it will split only on the 0x1F character. If not, then it will split on space and/or comma as it does now.

It is recommended (but not required) that clients using the SendMaterializationData RPC use 0x1f as the field separator.
